snippet: If the virus is detected early, people can be treated with antiviral drugs before symptoms develop.
abstract: Editorial cites recommendation by expert advisory group that Americans aged 15 to 65 be voluntarily screened for HIV, virus that causes AIDS; holds advice, similar to that of Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, comes on heels of reports that strong antiviral drugs given soon after detection may eliminate virus; holds early detection and treatment are necessary to finally bring AIDS epidemic under control.
lead_paragraph: If the virus is detected early, people can be treated with antiviral drugs before symptoms develop.
